subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In Taiwan, Hong Kong, Japanese {{w|kanji}}, Korean {{w|hanja}} and Vietnamese {{w|History of writing in Vietnam|Nôm}}, the component above <big>{{l|mul|萈}}</big> is written with <font size=4>[[⻀]]</font> (ram's horn component), which is the orthodox form found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.
* In mainland China (based on {{w|Xin Zixing}}, {{w2|zh|新字形}}), the component above <big>{{l|mul|萈}}</big> is written with <font size=4>{{l|mul|艹}}</font> (grass radical).

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: This character is not to be confused with {{l|mul|寛}} (U+5BDB), a Japanese [[shinjitai]] character, which has one dot missing and is encoded as a separate character.

subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text:
* <big>{{l|mul|[[寛]]}}</big> ''(Japanese {{w|shinjitai}}, also a {{w|Variant Chinese character|variant form}})''
* {{l|mul|[[宽]]}} ''({{w|Simplified Chinese}})''
